entry.title: Flood Warning issued September 13 at 1:41PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst continues. * WHERE...Kenai River near Below Skilak Lake, Including Kenai Keys. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 9:46AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Frost Possible Tonight... Frost is possible tonight across the Eastern Interior, including Fairbanks. Clear skies this evening will allow temperatures to fall rapidly after sunset, with temperature dropping into the 30s after midnight. Frost will be most likely in low lying areas. Clouds moving north over the area on Thursday morning will cause

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 14 at 1:09AM PDT until September 15 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Strong rip currents and elevated surf. Surf will be 3- 5 feet, with sets to 6 feet. Highest surf will be in northern Orange County. * WHERE...Orange County Coastal Areas.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 13 at 3:27PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT DUE TO ELEVATED PARTICULATE MATTER LEVELS FROM WINDBLOWN DUST... The South Coast AQMD has issued an air quality alert due to increased particulate matter from blowing dust. The air quality alert is in effect until 6AM on Friday . In areas directly impacted by high levels of windblown dust, limit

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 6:11AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog This Morning... Areas of dense fog will affect the morning commute. Be alert for rapid changes in visibility in short distances, to below a quarter mile or less in some spots. Slow down, use low beam headlights, and leave plenty of distance between your vehicle and the one ahead of you when encountering areas of fog.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 6:11AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog This Morning... Areas of dense fog will affect the morning commute. Be alert for rapid changes in visibility in short distances, to below a quarter mile or less in some spots.
